data.title: Films hope for the very best of British
data.meta_description: Two films with Barnet connections have been nominated for BAFTA awards.
data.text:
Gosford Park, the new British movie which was filmed at Wrotham Park, just north of Barnet, has been nominated for nine BAFTA awards.

Robert Altman, fresh from winning a Golden Globe has been nominated again as best director, while Helen Mirren and Dame Maggie Smith have both been nominated for Best Supporting Actress.

Writer Julian Fellows gets two nominations for Best Original Screenplay and the Carl Foreman Award for Most Promising Newcomer to British Film, while the film is up for the Alexander Korda Award for the Outstanding British Film of the Year despite being directed by an American.

Gosford Park, which is released tomorrow (Feb 1), is also up for Best Production Design, Best Costume Design and Best Make Up/Hair.

Meanwhile, Me Without You, which was co-written and directed by Hampstead Garden Suburb's Sandra Goldbacher, is also nominated for best British film of the year.

The movie, which was released in November last year, tells the story of two girls growing up in Hampstead Garden Suburb and stars Anna Friel (Brookside) and Michelle Williams (Dawson's Creek).

The BAFTA awards ceremony will be held on February 24.

January 29, 2002 17:00
